review.reviewText: Great breakfast.  Beautiful old world decor. Lots of thoughtful amenities in room and common areas. Lovely back yard with places to sit and sun. Also a hot tub.  Very friendly and efficient staff.

Friendly staff, Great breakfast

review.title: Comfi Victorian near the Mission district
review.reviewText: Great home base for a City that we love!  Walking distance to highly rated restaurants along Valencia, colorful scenes in the Mission and Castro, and tranquility in Noe Valley. Also easy to get BART, busses, taxis, or other transportation to all parts of the City. Staff at the Inn are extra helpful (i.e. Printing theater tickets for us, doing dishes after we warmed up leftovers from Mourad, etc.). Each room is different, but they leave the doors open of the vacant ones so you can scope out which one you might want next time.

photos.caption: lobby where breakfast is served (no breakfast in this picture)
walking down spiral staircase from rooftop
view from top of second floor staircase

review.title: Surprisingly nice hotel for price and location.
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly and very helpful. They let me check in as early as 8:45am on my way from the airport to a conference! I stayed in room 12 on the first floor. Spacious for an SF hotel. Everything was good quality, and the breakfast spread was awesome every morning. If you are loud and like privacy, you might not love it, though, because you can kind of hear stuff in other spaces (just like in a normal old house). The gardens are beautiful and spacious with lots of separate lounging areas. There's a nice hot tub in a covered gazebo outside. There's a spiral staircase on the third floor that goes to a rooftop access with tables, chairs, and 360 view of city. They only charge $2 for sodas and bottled water (honor system!), and offer coffee/tea all day and free sherry and port for customers in the lobby. All of the antiques are all beautiful, and they really keep their plants up. I also had a room with my own full bath (soaker tub, shower, sink, toilet), which is NOT a given when staying in San Francisco's Mission District.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff & nice property for a B&B. Could get a nice room with a private bath for under $180/night. Near cool stuff to do & inexpensive food.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if you couldn't hear thru walls so easily. If staying in room #12, be warned that it's next to the patio access door. Kids get loud.
review.locationRemarks: 5 minute walk or less from Alamo Draft House. Near lots of good restaurants, including 15min walk to Locanda (amazing non-rustic Italian).

review.title: Great Vintage SF home.
review.reviewText: Excellent stay. Would stay there again. Not much else to say. Breakfast was fine. Appreciated the sherry available in the sitting area.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep it the way it is.
review.locationRemarks: We were visiting our son, so activity nearby was not a factor for us.

review.title: Great Option in the Mission
review.reviewText: This is a quaint and charming B&B.  I plan to stay here regularly.

review.title: Victorian gem hidden in plain sight in the Mission
review.reviewText: Spent three nights at the Inn while visiting my daughter who lives in the Mission District of the City.  Great location, friendly helpful staff, very Victorian harking back to early 1900s San Francisco, generous buffet breakfast.  I definitely would recommend the Inn to others.

review.title: Great spot in beautiful Potrero Hill area of SF
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed staying at the Inn! Great breakfast - fresh fruit, vegetarian quiches and so much more! Clean cozy rooms, old Victorian style building and interior. I'd definitely stay again!

review.title: GOEGEOUS SF VICTORIAN
review.reviewText:
ROOF TOP 360 VIEWS OF ESS EFF

JACUZZI TUB W/ROBES <3

CANDY, FRESH FRUIT IN-ROOM
Very good experience. Would stay again and recommend. Very charming.

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: What an excellent stay. It's an adult style B&B that is calm, peaceful, mature & relaxing. If you like classical music, a glass of port and reading a good article in the New Yorker yet completely unpretenious you will LOVE this place. I actually miss it and will go back.
review.locationRemarks: Walk up to Valencia street (few blocks) & shop in local shops adn eat at terrific restaurants.

review.title: Great Inn with a homey feeling
review.reviewText:
I absolutely loved being in the Inn. First of all I was greeted very warmly by the staff and even though I arrived a bit early they let me check in to the room early and gave me a tour of the place. There are so many small touches that make it feel like a home away from home - coffee all day, cookies, fruit, newspapers, books, magazines, a scrumptious breakfast better than any I'd had traveling all around Europe.
My room was the smaller one in the Inn but it was still cozy, clean and comfortable. I usually don't go into lobbies of hotels but this lobby area, which is really like the family room, was so inviting I found myself going there whenever I had a few minutes spare time.
The Inn was also located in a perfect place for me since my daughter lives in the Mission area. They gave me a map of all the restaurants in the area that are recommended and it was terrific seeing so many choices. The first one I went to was just a few minutes walk away and the food was excellent, just like the recommendation. Absolutely everyone at the Inn made me feel at home and they even invited my daughter to join me in breakfast, something I found above and beyond what any other place would have done. I am definitely going to be coming back!
review.positiveRemarks: The atmosphere, the location, the food, the extras offered (coffee, fruit etc.), even the halloween candy!
review.negativeRemarks: My only problem was climbing the first set of stairs with my luggage - but they graciously took my suitcase up the 2nd set of stairs!
review.locationRemarks: Located in the Mission - my daughter took me to several coffee shops nearby, and showed me around the area. The shops around there are really nice too

review.title: Fantastic place - cozy and romantic
review.reviewText: I can't think of a thing I could give a negative comment about. The staff is amazing. The hotel is something special - a little get away in a great location. Friendly, romantic and unique - we will be back

review.title: Beautifully fantastic with old world charm
review.reviewText:
I had only stayed at a few bed and breakfasts in my life and this is the best one hands down! The quiet room the friendly, helpful staff were a Godsend and the plethera of breakfast selections served until 11 AM were unsurpassed!! We didn't feel rushed to make it to breakfast we could lounge in bed until we were ready to get up. I also really loved the fresh flowers and fruit in the room. If I had a complaint which I am pressed to do so it is that the H2O in the shower fluctuated hot and cold willy nilly.
Anyone who says this B&B is haunted is a lunatic! We experienced NONE of the paranormal activity claimed in this establishment.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast had a HUGE selection of everything. The rooftop access,wassweet the grounds are well manicured and pleasant to just sit and enjoy a book
review.negativeRemarks: the sudden change in water temperature.

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: Everything about The Inn, from general ambiance to staff to services including a large jacuzzi and fantastic breakfast, are top notch. I was thoroughly impressed by the whole experience. A home away from home.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, jacuzzi, ambiance, decor, comfort, cheerful and helpful staff, free snacks and beverages, rooftop views, lounge, location.

review.title: Return to comfort and individuality
review.reviewText: Generous breakfast aesthetically served in warm, comfortable surroundings.

review.title: Inn
review.reviewText: Gorgeous SF property that has been immaculately restored. Bed in my room seemed to balloon in the centre and shower was tricky to get hot-cold balance right. Friendly staff, great ambience, lots of good magazines and newspapers, rooftop deck and view is wonderful. Corn quiche at breakfast was nice but coffee was so-so. Recommended.

review.title: SF Oasis in the Mission
review.reviewText: The hospitality of the staff & owner was excellent. We stayed in the annex adjacent to the main house & were upgraded to a larger room We would have been satisfied with a smaller room since we chose the B & B for its proximity to Bernal Heights & uniqueness of a B & B stay in SF versus our usual Hotel visits. We liked the variety offered at breakfast time & the option to enjoy breakfast in our rooms. Great roof top views & convenient public transportation options nearby.

review.title: Unique and fun place to stay
review.reviewText: Awesome rooftop views, comfortable, unique place to stay. Very homey and welcoming. A nice change from the corporate hotel visit, a taste of historic San Francisco.

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: Lovely building, friendly staff and guests, awesome breakfast! We loved it.

review.title: Good hotel with lots of character
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend the Inn in San Fran....the staff were really helpful and recommended great places to eat nearby. The hotel itself was full of character, a treasure trove of antiques, the garden was beautiful and they have a roof terrace with an amazing view of the whole city. The bedrooms were decorated indivdually, really quirky...It felt like we were staying at a friends home rather than a hotel. The only down point was the size of the 'cozy' room - it's very cozy! I wouldn't book the cozy room again if I returned. The location was great - the Mission district has lots of good places to hang out...Valencia was a really good street for vintage shopping. I hope to return soon!

review.title: A fun experience
review.reviewText: This was one of the few places I could find for my business trip when all the other hotels were filled by a convention. Very close to the BART and public bus, and an interesting neighborhood that I never found uncomfortable. The hotel was a great find for being so unique and laid-back, and the interior decor is incredible. I wish it had a larger television and better WIFI (I had to use my computer in the first floor drawing rooms--but there are worse inconveniences in life). Very affordable, great breakfast. Definately will stay there again.

review.title: An Unexpected Treat
review.reviewText: Was here on business for one day. What an unexpected treat. If you want to experience how old SF felt like, come here. The facility was clean and beautiful. They even have a hot tub in a lovely garden setting which I used before going to bed and when i awoke. The staff was great. Breakfast was superb. Coffee, tea, brandy was served all day. Drinking water dispensers were every where. The roof top deck had killer views and wireless access. This was truely an unexpected treat. I will be staying here in the future.

review.title: Excellent Bed & Breakfast
review.reviewText: Beautiful antique decor, great hospitality and excellent service. I only wish we could have stayed here longer!

review.title: A San Fracisco Treasure!
review.reviewText: Staff is very friendly and helpful.Had one issue with the bathroom but was fixed same day we said something. We were charged extra to ensure a private bathroom,a bathroom that we had to walk down the hall to get to,From what i could tell all the other rooms had private baths in the rooms so not sure what that was about and this was the only negative.I didn't mind the walk down the hall as i was told beforehand,just that i was charged extra for a bathroom that wasn't shared by anyone in the first place. They do a very thorough job of cleaning,some things are old and worn and should be replace but overall was very well taken care of. Fresh flowers abound daily! The sitting room is jam packed full of daily newspapers and books on the history of san francisco and area attractions. Breakfast is fresh and fantastic everyday!Awoke to the smell of fresh brewed coffee everyday.Huge variety of fresh fruits,pastries,quiche and juices. The neighborhood is not all that great but i never had any problems and i never felt unsafe. In conclussion i think this is a great place to stay and was one of the highlights of my vacation.I would and have recommended to it to all my friends and family!

review.title: Beautiful spot in the Mission
review.reviewText: The parlors (and my room) were beautifully (antiquely) appointed. The garden was very inviting, and the roof deck offered spectacular views of the city. The staff was friendly and efficient.

review.title: Inn sweet Inn
review.reviewText: This is a gem of a find. If you are looking to stay somewhere with a little character then the Inn of SF is your place. Staying at the Inn help made our trip something special.
